title: No fans allowed? What a season without full stadiums could mean for the NFL (Football 5/14)
description:
The NFL is bracing for a season without full stadiums. It's hard to believe, but it's the truth. Jonathan Jones joins Will Brinson to discuss his 3-part series on CBSSports.com on the various ways that the absence of fans could impact the league. The guys cover how the salary cap would be affected and how TV contracts might play a factor. Will and JJ also examine the possibility of some fans being allowed to attend games as well as how home-field advantage could continue to change.
Read Part 1: How empty stadiums could cost NFL teams
Read Part 2: How teams are preparing for a major salary cap hit
Read Part 3: How home-field advantage could be affected
'Pick Six' is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Stitcher, Google Podcasts, Castbox, Bullhorn and wherever else you listen to podcasts.
